Federal government websites often end in .gov or .mil. Before sharing sensitive information, make sure you're on a federal government site.

The site is secure.
The https:// ensures that you are connecting to the official website and that any information you provide is encrypted and transmitted securely.

Repository.PKI.Gov
  • Documents
  • FAQs

A public repository for the U.S. Federal Public Trust TLS PKI

This site contains information on the U.S. Federal Public Trust Transport Layer Security (TLS) Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), an infrastructure which supports automated issuance of digital certificates for Federal .mil and .gov web services.

Learn more

Featured Links:

CA Certificates: Download copies of the Issuing Certification Authority (CA) and Root CA certificates.

Policy Documents: Download the latest Certificate Policy, Root CA Certification Practices Statement (CPS), or Issuing CA CPS.

Audit Reports: Download the most recent WebTrust Principles and Criteria for Certification Authorities or WebTrust Principles and Criteria for Certification Authorities - SSL Baseline with Network Security audit reports.
